segment: Good morning and welcome to the regular meeting of City Council for Tuesday, April 15 2025. The President and President Pro Tem of Pittsburgh City Council are both unable to attend this morning's meeting. Therefore, under Rule 5. 1 in the Rules of Council, the Clerk shall first take a roll call and then the members shall elect a temporary President Pro Tem to preside over the meeting.
matching_summary: The Pittsburgh City Council convened on April 15, 2025, and initiated proceedings to elect a temporary President Pro Tem due to the absence of both the President and President Pro Tem, following Rule 5.1 of the Council's Rules.
match1_summary: Resolution 2025-1668 approves the reappointment of Janet Evans to the Housing Authority of City of Pittsburgh Board of Directors through December 31, 2029.
match2_summary: Resolution 2024-0986 approves the reappointment of Aftyn Giles to the Clean Pittsburgh Commission for a term ending September 1, 2028.
match3_summary: Resolution 2025-1723 authorizes the City of Pittsburgh to enter into easement agreements with Duquesne Light Company and Pittsburgh Water for utility infrastructure placement and maintenance on city-owned property, sponsored by Council Member Gross and unanimously approved by the council.

segment: Can a Clerk please take the roll? Mr Sharland Here. Mr Coghill Here. Ms Gross Here Mr Mosley Here Mrs Kale-Smith Here. Mrs Strasburger Here Mrs Warwick, Here Mr Wilson, Here Mr LaVelle. President, Five members present.
matching_summary: Roll Call for City Council meeting with six council members (Sharland, Coghill, Gross, Mosley, Kale-Smith, Strasburger, Warwick, Wilson, LaVelle) confirmed as present, with five members initially noted.
match1_summary: City Council received a weekly grants status update communication from Jake Pawlak, Director of Office of Management and Budget, via Resolution 2025-1734, which was read, received, and filed.
match2_summary: Resolution 2025-1725 recommends the City Council read, receive, and file the Committee on Public Works and Infrastructure report from April 9, 2025, as presented by Councilwoman Barbara Warwick.
match3_summary: Resolution 2025-1684 approves the sale of two lots on Erin Street in Pittsburgh's 5th Ward from the Urban Redevelopment Authority to the Pittsburgh Land Bank at no cost to the City, which was unanimously passed by 8 council members.

segment: The floor is now open to Council to elect their temporary President Pro Tem. Motion to nominate Councilwoman Strasburger as the temporary Pro Tem. Second Councilperson Strasburger will now take over as President Pro Tem.
matching_summary: Council Procedural Action: Councilwoman Strasburger elected as temporary President Pro Tem through nomination and seconding motion.
match1_summary: RES. 2025-1724: Councilwoman Erika Strassburger presents the Finance and Law Committee's April 9, 2025 report, recommending affirmative action and seeking to read, receive, and file the matter.
match2_summary: Resolution 2025-1730 authorizes Councilman R. Daniel Lavelle's appointment of Anne Marie Ellison as a Member of the LGBTQIA+ Commission with a term ending April 1, 2029.
match3_summary: Resolution 2025-1668 approves the reappointment of Janet Evans to the Housing Authority of City of Pittsburgh Board of Directors through December 31, 2029.
